intro: Haloragis oligantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved willowherb, is a flowering plant native to parts of Australia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in coastal or inland regions. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or purple in color, blooming during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it has a creeping growth habit with erect flowering stems. Haloragis oligantha is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments, showing resilience to drought and salt exposure.
